data.title: Landslide hits southern Thailand's Betong
data.description: YALA: A landslide happened in Betong district in this southern border province on Sunday morning. No one was injured.

data.title: Israel warns citizens of terror threat in Southeast Asia with focus on Thailand
data.description: Israel warned its citizens that the threat of terrorism against them in Southeast Asia has intensified.

data.title: 'Influential ties' not a factor in land probe, says Narumon
data.description: Agriculture and Cooperatives Minister Narumon Pinyosinwat has vowed to take action against any encroachment of Sor Por Kor agricultural reform land by a romantic partner linked to a former deputy prime minister.

data.title: No good deed; polite thief strikes; body on roof saga
data.description: The owner of a BMW who pawned his vehicle in Nonthaburi has gone to police after the garage which helped arrange the financing refused to pay a repair bill when it was later involved in an accident.

data.title: Phuket to tackle food waste crisis
data.description: Phuket has introduced a food waste management initiative aimed at reducing waste by 15 tonnes daily as part of its effort to become a low-carbon destination.

data.title: Online gambling sites lure over 4m young Thais
data.description: More than four million young Thai people have been drawn into online gambling, which risks developing into an addiction that takes a toll on their health, according to experts.

data.title: Rama II motorway construction put on hold after fatal crane collapse
data.description: Transport Minister Suriya Jungrungreangkit has ordered work on a city motorway to be suspended for two weeks after Friday

data.title: Flood death toll rises to nine in South
data.description: SONGKHLA - The death toll from the worst floods in decades in southern Thailand climbed to nine on Saturday, as thousands of people were evacuated due to rising water levels.

data.title: 31 crew from Thai boats ‘taken into Myanmar’
data.description: More than 30 crew members of Thai  fishing boats  were detained in  Myanmar  waters on Saturday after three Myanmar patrol vessels opened fire on them, leaving one person dead and two injured, a navy commander said.

data.title: German woman bitten by fish in Phangnga
data.description: PHANGNGA - Authorities have issued a warning to tourists in Takua Pa district of this southern Thai province after a German tourist was bitten by an unidentified fish, leaving an oval-shaped wound approximately 20 centimetres long.

data.title: Two fake policemen nabbed
data.description: Two Thai men have been arrested for posing as police to rob Vietnamese tourists in Bangkok.

data.title: Two tourists drown in Samui
data.description: SURAT THANI - Two people, one of them a Russian tourist, have drowned near Chaweng Beach on Koh Samui due to strong waves.

data.title: Cameroonian-Thai duo arrested in ‘CP’ export scam
data.description: A Cameroonian man and a Thai woman have been arrested for operating a company that deceived buyers into thinking it was affiliated with a major agribusiness company, resulting in more than 3.5 million baht in damages, police say.

data.title: New Bang Yai-Kanchanaburi motorway toll-free over New Year
data.description: The new  motorway  that will link Bang Yai district in Nonthaburi with  Kanchanaburi  province will be open for motorists to travel free of charge over the New Year holiday period.

data.title: Pornographer captured after keeping victim, 10, on boat for a month
data.description: A 10-year-old child has been rescued by police after being sexually assaulted offshore of Rayong province for nearly a month.

data.title: Floodwaters recede in Hat Yai's economic areas
data.description: SONGKHLA — Floodwaters have begun to recede in the economic zones of Hat Yai, while other parts of the tourist district remain inundated.

data.title: Bangkok postpones plan to close major road
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) has postponed plans to close the elevated road on Rama IX from Dec 2 this year until further notice.

data.title: 14 charter change bills set for debate on House return
data.description: A total of 14 bills partially amending the 2017 constitution are set to be deliberated when the House reconvenes next month, Speaker Wan Muhamad Noor Matha said on Friday.

data.title: A question of leadership
data.description: The prospect of the next polls in 2027 being run under the current constitution shouldn

data.title: 14 charter change bills set for debate on House return
data.description: A total of 14 bills partially amending the 2017 constitution are set to be deliberated when the House reconvenes next month, the speaker Wan Muhamad Noor Matha said yesterday.

data.title: Thailand, US to resume direct flights
data.description: Thailand and the United States are expected to resume direct flights in February of next year when the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) of the US Department of Transportation upgrades Thai aviation safety from Category 2 to Category 1, according to Deputy Prime Minister and Transport Minister Suriya Jungrungreangkit.

data.title: A question of leadership
data.description: The prospect of the next polls in 2027 being run under the current constitution shouldn

data.title: Formaldehyde found in e-cig samples, dept says
data.description: The Department of Disease Control (DDC) has warned that formaldehyde was found in samples of e-cigarette liquids sold illegally in Thailand and that the aerosol of the chemical can cause cancer.

data.title: BMA postpones plan to close major road
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) has postponed plans to close the elevated road on Rama IX from Dec 2 this year until further notice.

data.title: Fast progress in Chiang Rai rail project
data.description: The construction of a new railway project with four tunnels designed to withstand the impact of natural disasters in Chiang Rai has progressed by 20%, said the Department of Rail Transport

data.title: PM urges people not to protest over sea border row
data.description: The government yesterday urged people not to take to the streets over the controversial 2001 Thailand-Cambodia memorandum of understanding (MoU) on joint development in the Gulf of Thailand, saying Thailand would not lose an inch of its territory to Cambodia.

data.title: B19bn to fix two northern provinces
data.description: The government has approved 19 billion baht to fix infrastructure and utilities in Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai following the recent heavy floods, government spokesman Jirayu Houngsub said.

data.title: Picket over land loss decrees
data.description: About 5,000 members of the assembly of the people living in community forests stormed Chiang Mai City Hall on Friday, demanding the government stop the implementation of the royal decrees on conserving and protecting natural resources in national parks and wildlife reserves as the laws will have a severe impact on the way of life of their communities.

data.title: Govt revs up flood aid in South
data.description: The government is stepping up efforts to help flood victims in several provinces in the South as more than 240,000 households were hit by severe flooding triggered by days of heavy rainfall.

data.title: 20-baht transit fare extended for 2025
data.description: The cabinet has approved a budget of 400 million baht to support the extension of the  20-baht flat fare  for the Red and Purple  electric train  lines for another year.
